item.title: Principles of Microeconomics learning panel
item.description:
This platform supports the teaching of microeconomics.

It allows the user to interact configuring scenarios of economic policies and check the results.

item.title: Macroeconomics learning panel
item.description:
This platform supports the teaching of macroeconomics.

It facilitates the access to updated macroeconomic indicators.

It allows the user to interact configuring scenarios of economic policies and check the results according to different macroeconomic models.

The platform has been developed with the colaboration of Juan Luis Eugenio Martí.

item.title: Multimodal cartography of transport infrastructures in the Canary Islands
item.description:
It carries out a cartography of the existing road and port infrastructures in the Canary Islands.

The project was funded by Gobierno de Canarias.

This project was realized with Francisco Javier Campos Méndez and Carmen García Galindo.

item.title: International Tourism Demand Model
item.description:
This platform develops a methodology to anticipate international tourism demand by distinguishing the outbound market. The starting point is the construction of a baseline scenario that predicts the demand that would have occurred in 2020 and 2021 had the epidemic not existed. This baseline demand is affected by the situation with Covid-19 considering three effects:

  1. The date of market reactivation according to the epidemic for each pair of origin-destination (based on an epidemiological SIR model);

  2. The reduction in income at origin and how it reduces the intention to travel (based on a panel data model);

  3. The reduction in confidence to travel (using post-pandemic travel surveys).

These three effects reduce the expected pre-Covid19 demand and allow realistic adjustments according to the value of post-Covid expected demand.

item.title: Panel de indicadores de COVID-19 en Lanzarote
item.description: A contribution made with Christian González-Martel to Cabildo de Lanzarote. This shiny web application pursues the understanding of the situation of COVID-19 in Lanzarote. It shows the main indicators and its daily evolution.

item.title: Panel de indicadores de turismo de Lanzarote
item.description:
This project pursues the improvement of tourism information to Lanzarote. A shiny web application is developed to collects data from ISTAC concerning demand and supply of tourism in Canary Islands and specially in Lanzarote. The data povided by the web application is related to arrivals, expenditure and occupation.

This project is leaded by Centro de datos de Lanzarote which is the departament of Island Council which provides with statistical information to Lanzarote and Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria and funded by Cabildo de Lanzarote.

The work was done with Christian González-Martel.
